content: the fisherman beanie is my all time favorite crochet beanie pattern i first launched this pattern as a shop item in my wool intentions etsy shop where it s been a best seller for years as it s a simple yet classic beanie that looks great on everyone this pattern is worked back and forth in row then seamed with a slip_stitch seam one end will then be cinched and closed yarn quince & co lark 134 yards two skeins the color pictured is caspian while i recommend quince & co lark for this pattern most worsted weight - category 4 yarns should work nicely 268 yards will be needed hook us h / 5mm note gauge is important for this pattern the stitch pattern used creates a fabric that is stretchy and fits an average head size of 18-23 a looser gauge will result in a hat that is larger than this size a tighter gauge will create a smaller hat take a moment to make a gauge swatch and adjust your hook size if necessary when measuring your gauge make sure to measure it when your crochet fabric is un-stretched sharing your work online please tag @woolintentions #woolintentions #fishermanbeanie i d love to see your work
